The correct timeline is: 3 -> 5 -> 1 -> 2 -> 6 -> 4
Option B best fits the sequence of events as it starts with the person describing their location and surroundings, followed by them explaining their process of creating a planetary image using software. They then mention the limitations of their equipment before finally starting the processing run.

The correct timeline is: 2 -> 6 -> 1 -> 7 -> 4 -> 5 -> 3
Option B correctly orders the events based on the description provided in the audio. The sequence starts with setting up the equipment on the deck (option 2), followed by optimizing options for planetary images (option 6). Then, he captures an image of Jupiter and Saturn (option 1), which is then merged with another image in Photoshop (option 3). After that, he aligns the frames and stacks them using AutoStakkert and RegiStax (options 4 and 5). Finally, he checks for any shaky objects in the captured images (option 7) and processes the images using PIPP (option 8).
